If you are depressed, it is unlikely that you are able to ignore the thought. I can see why thinking about this can lead to depression. There is no telling what the world will be like 20 years from now. For all you know, it may turn out
to be the type of place that you wouldn't WANT to live in.

On the other hand, 20 years from now medical and health sciences may find a way to prolong life. It's impossible to predict. People who get depressed have a tendency to ruminate upon the future. Look at it this way: you are here today,
and there is little reason to think that you will be gone tomorrow. Enjoy what you can now, and you will be less preoccupied with your own mortality.
That is a pretty good trick. You must be the type of person who can completely blot unpleasant thoughts from your mind.

It used to be believed that people who do this are unhealthy, but research is beginning to indicate that it can be healthy in some situations. It may indeed be healthy not to let yourself worry about things over which you have no control.
